Authors: Zai-Wei Ge, Tianxiu Xu, Hua Qu, Yunrui Ma
Title:
Amphi-Pacific disjunct distribution of Smithiomyces: with
descriptions of three new species from China
Keywords:
Agaricales, amphi-pacific, biogeography, disjunction,
taxonomy, 3 new taxa
Abstract:
Based on morphological characteristics and four-gene
(internal transcribed spacer, ITS; large subunit ribosomal RNA gene,
LSU; RNA polymerase Ⅱ second largest subunit, rpb2; the translation
elongation factor 1-α gene, tef1-α) phylogenetic inferences,
Smithiomyces is reported for the first time from tropical region in
China, suggesting that this genus follows an Amphi-Pacific disjunct
distribution pattern. Detailed morphological descriptions are provided
for the newly described species S. asiaticus, S. heterosporus and S.
lepiotoides, including color images of fresh basidiomata in habitat,
line drawings of the main anatomical features, transmitted light
microscopic images of anatomical features and scanning electron
microscope images of basidiospores. A key to known species within
Smithiomyces has also been provided.
